maml:description.maml:para: Copies one or more audio files to new files located on a file system drive.
The Copy-AudioFile cmdlet copies one or more audio files to a specified directory.
The new file name(s) and/or directory can be generated from metadata by specifying keys inside curly braces. For more information, type "Get-Help Copy-AudioFile -Examples".
Writes the resulting audio file to the console. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Writes the resulting audio file to the console. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command copies song.wav from the current directory to C:\Output\song.wav
This command copies song.wav from the current directory to C:\Output\copiedsong.wav
This command copies all the .flac files in the current directory to a new directory structure under C:\Output, using metadata to construct the directory structure and file names.

This command copies all the .flac files found anywhere under the Myself user's Music directory to a new directory structure under C:\Output, using metadata to construct the directory structure and file names.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more audio files located on a file system drive.
The Get-AudioFile cmdlet gets one or more audio files in a specified directory. Relative paths and wildcards are supported.
For more complex operations, such as recursively searching through a directory tree, you can use Get-ChildItem and then pipe the results into Get-AudioFile.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets an audio file named song.wav in the current directory.
This command gets all audio files with a .wav extension in the current directory.
This command gets all audio files with a .wav extension in the Myself user's Music directory.
This command recursively gets all audio files with a .wav extension in the Myself user's Music directory and all subfolders.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the audio information describing one or more audio files.
The Get-AudioInfo cmdlet simply returns the AudioInfo property for one or more audio files.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the audio information for an audio file named song.wav in the current directory.
This command gets the audio information for all audio files with the *.wav extension in the current directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets metadata ("tags") associated with one or more audio files.
The Get-AudioMetadata cmdlet returns metadata values for one or more audio files, specified by Key.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the title for an audio file named song.flac in the current directory.
This command gets the title and track number for an audio file named song.flac in the current directory.
This command gets the title for all audio files with the .flac extension in the current directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Applies an analysis algorithm to one or more audio files.

The Measure-AudioFile cmdlet generates metadata about one or more audio files by examining the audio streams with the specified analyzer. Passing multiple audio files to a single cmdlet instance will treat them as a single album, or grouping. This cmdlet will never modify the audio itself.
To get a list of available analyzers, use the Get-MeasureAudioFileAnalyzer cmdlet.
The results can be retrieved with the Get-AudioMetadata cmdlet, or by accessing the Metadata property directly. To persist the results to disk, use the Save-AudioMetadata cmdlet.
Writes the modified audio file to the console. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Writes the modified audio file to the console. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command applies ReplayGain analysis to song.wav in the current directory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-AudioFile song.wav | Measure-AudioFile ReplayGain -PassThru | Get-AudioMetadata TrackPeak

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command applies ReplayGain analysis to song.wav in the current directory, then returns the measured TrackPeak value.
This command applies ReplayGain analysis to song.wav in the current directory, then persists the results to disk.
This command applies ReplayGain analysis to all audio files with a *.flac extension in the current directory. The files are treated as a single album.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-ChildItem C:\Users\Myself\Music -Directory -Recurse | % { $_ | Get-ChildItem -File -Filter *.flac | Measure-AudioFile ReplayGain -PassThru | Save-AudioMetadata }

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command applies ReplayGain analysis to all audio files with a *.flac extension found anywhere under the Myself user's Music directory. Each directory is processed as a separate album. Finally, the results are persisted to disk.

maml:description.maml:para: Renames one or more audio files on a file system drive.
The Rename-AudioFile cmdlet copies one or more audio files to a specified directory.
The new file name(s) can be generated from metadata by specifying keys inside curly braces. For more information, type "Get-Help Rename-AudioFile -Examples".
Writes the renamed audio file to the console. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Writes the renamed audio file to the console. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command renames song.wav in the current directory to renamed.wav.
This command renames song.wav in the current directory to a new name based on the TrackNumber and Title metadata values.

maml:description.maml:para: Persists changes or additions to one or more audio files' metadata to disk.
The Save-AudioMetadata cmdlet persists the current metadata to one or more audio files.
Writes the audio file back to the console. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Writes the audio file back to the console. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the title on song.flac to "Test Song" and then persists the change to disk.
This command updates song.mp3 with a new tag suitable for iTunes.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the metadata on one or more audio files.
The Set-AudioMetadata cmdlet sets metadata on one or more audio files using HashTable syntax.
Writes the modified audio file to the console. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Writes the modified audio file to the console. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the title on song.flac to "Test Song".
This command sets the title on song.flac to "Test Song" and then persists the change to disk.

maml:description.maml:para: ncodes one or more audio files to new files located on a file system drive.
The Export-AudioFile cmdlet encodes one or more audio files using the specified encoder, and saves the resulting files in a specified directory.
To get a list of available encoders, use the Get-AudioEncoderList cmdlet.
The resulting file name(s) and/or directory can be generated from metadata by specifying keys inside curly braces. For more information, type "Get-Help Export-AudioFile -Examples".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command exports song.wav in the current directory to a new FLAC file with the same name, using default settings.
This command exports song.wav in the current directory to a new Wave file, replacing the original.
This command exports song.wav in the current directory to a new FLAC file with the same name, using compression level 8.
This command exports all the .flac files in the current directory to MP3 files under C:\Output, using metadata to construct the directory structure and file names.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets detailed information about the available encoders.
The Get-AudioEncoderInfo cmdlet provides detailed information about the available encoders currently loaded by PowerShell Audio.
Gets detailed information about the available metadata encoders.
The Get-AudioMetadataEncoderInfo cmdlet provides detailed information about the available metadata encoders currently loaded by PowerShell Audio.
Gets detailed information about the available analyzers.
The Get-AudioAnalyzerInfo cmdlet provides detailed information about the available analyzers currently loaded by PowerShell Audio.
